description: The Creed star brought his wife Jennifer Flavin and their three gorgeous daughters Sistene, Sophia and Scarlet with him to the Golden Globes in Los Angeles on Sunday.
title: The Stallone fan club! Sylvester is joined by Jennifer Flavin and their three daughters as he wins the Globe for Best Supporting Actor
title_page: The Stallone fan club! Sylvester is joined by Jennifer Flavin and their three daughters as he wins the Globe for Best Supporting Actor | Daily Mail Online
text:
Sylvester Stallone had his family by his side as he arrived at the Golden Globes.
The Creed actor was joined by his biggest fans, wife Jennifer Flavin, 47, and daughters Sophia, 19, Sistine, 17, and 13-year-old Scarlet as he arrived at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles on Sunday evening.
The 69-year-old, who was named Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture, looked sharp in a blue tuxedo.
Scroll down for video
Proud family: Sylvester Stallone with wife Jennifer Flavin and their daughters, from left, Sistine, Sophia and Scarlet at the Beverly Hilton in Los Angeles on Sunday
The actor has won rave reviews after reprising his role as boxer Rocky Balboa in spin-off Creed.
On Sunday, Sly looked proud and relaxed as he walked the red carpet with his wife and daughters.
Jennifer, 47, wore a strapless grey gown with sheer, flowing skirt and train.
Family affair: The actor won Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture for his role in Creed
The dress featured dark metallic detailing on the waist, and she added a dark clutch.
The couple's daughters also looked pretty as they posed on the red carpet.
Sophia, 19, wore a long black gown with plunging neckline and cinched in her waist with a black and gold metallic belt.
Comeback: The star was greeted by a standing ovation as he took the stage
Action star: Stallone joked that he wanted to thank Rocky Balboa, calling his legendary character 'the best friend I ever had'
Celebrating: Stallone beamed as he posed with his proud wife and daughters after his big win
Big win: The actor showed off his Best Supporting Actor award backstage
Sistine, 17, matched her famous father with a dark navy material, wearing a strapless gown and holding a dark blue clutch.
And 13-year-old Scarlet wore a white outfit featuring a see-through, strapless bodice, side cut outs and floor-length skirt.
The 69-year-old received a standing ovation as he won for Creed, almost 40 years after winning a Golden Globe for Best Screenplay for Rocky.
Still got it: The Rocky star won over a new generation of fans with his role in Creed
Fan club: Sly showed off his big win with his pretty daughters by his side
Supportive: The Creed star thanked his wife and daughters, calling their love 'the greatest award there is'
'Thank you!' Sly said on stage. 'I am gonna try not to get emotional because I am the sum total of every person I ever met. Last time I was here was 1977.'
And he thanked his wife and daughters for their love and support.
'I want to thank my wife and children. Actually having your love is the greatest award there is.'
And he joked: 'I want to thank my imaginary friend Rocky Balboa for being the best friend I ever had.'
The champ: The actor first won a Golden Globe for the original Rocky back in 1977
Pretty: Jennifer looked gorgeous in a strapless gown with sheer skirt and flowing train
Back in the gym: The actor played legendary character Rocky Balboa in Creed, which also starred Michael B Jordan
